responsibilities: Developed an application to make scanned Iranian historical newspapers searchable through Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).
Converted scanned archives into machine-readable text, improving accessibility for researchers and historians.
Implemented full-text and semantic search, enabling efficient and intuitive document retrieval.
Created graph-based search to explore document relationships through interactive graph visualizations.
Built a chatbot assistant for natural language queries, simplifying archive exploration for users.
Developed a custom Agentic Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) solution providing advanced analytics via a chatbot interface.
Fine-tuned Large Language Models to enhance semantic search, question answering, and function calling capabilities.
Built automated web scraping tools for large-scale data collection from over 50 sources.
Designed and built a data warehouse as the sole data scientist, reducing reporting time by 70%.
Created scalable ETL pipelines to integrate data from over 11 sources for unified data processing.
Delivered actionable insights through connected dashboards for marketing, finance, and operations teams.
Improved BC Data Catalogue's search precision by 25% and recall by 40% with a new semantic search system.
Developed topic modeling solutions with interactive visualizations to enhance user experience.
Received two awards for project presentation and featured recognition on the UBC website.
Automated data scraping pipelines for extracting structured and unstructured data from more than 40 sources.
Optimized ETL pipelines, increasing data processing efficiency by 20%.
